result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.

3:15 PM Cases 22CF94, 22CF140, and 22CM29 called together.  Defendant Andrea May Milek appeared by phone.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Andrea May Milek.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: def was to do some programming, would help with a resolution.  Def makes statement.  Court to set 1 more stc.

Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

11:26 AM Cases 22CF94, 22CF140, and 22CM29 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrea May Milek appeared by video.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Andrea May Milek.  Case 22CF94 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Case 22CF140 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  Offer has been extended, needs to discuss.
Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:00 PM Called 22CF94 for PH, 22CM29 for STC and 22CF140 for INIT.  Defendant Andrea May Milek appeared by phone.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alysja Otten appeared by video for Andrea May Milek. Court questions def, Attny Otten and DA willing to proceed.  Attny Otten notified JA that PH would be a WOPH today.  Attny Otten and def confirm they wish to proceed remotely today.  Case 22CF94 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information. PD's office would need a new application from def to cover new charges in 22CF140 on for INIT.  Request Adjournment for INIT, def to apply with PD's office.  Court requests def to appear in person next court date as bad connection.
Arraignment and adjourned INIT scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:45 am.

The defendant must post $250 additional cash bond to be released from custody, for a total of $500 cash bond to cover cases 22CM29, 22CF94, and 22GF147.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm. Faxed to Barron Co Jail.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:42 AM Called 22CF94 for INIT and 22CM29 for STC.  Defendant Andrea May Milek in court with Attorney Alysja Otten.  Defendant in Burnett Co custody at Barron Co Jail.  DA James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Andrea May Milek appeared by video means.  Case 22CF94 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. NG plea entered on misdemeanors.  Attny Otten notes comfortable with PH outside of time limits, def anticipates starting program on Sun.  On probation hold until Sun, then cash bond here.  60-90 days for program.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
